reviews.author: JK1
reviews.comment_content:
Topic I: Introduction to Quantum Theory
1.1. Energy Quantisation: E=hv
1.2. Wave-particle duality: de-Broglie Relation λ = h / p

Topic II: Motion
2.1. Translation: Free Particle, Particle in a box (1-D and higher dimensional)
2.2. Quantum Tunneling
2.3. Vibration
2.4. Rotation (2-D and 3-D)

Topic III: Atomic Structure
3.1. Atomic Spectrum of Hydrogen
3.2. Wavefunction for hydrogenic atoms
3.3. Atomic orbitals and Energies; shells and subshells
3.4. Many-electron systems (Aufbau Principle, Pauli exclusion Principle, Hund's Rule)
3.5. Periodicity; Atomic spectroscopy

Topic IV: Molecules
4.1. Born-Oppenheimer Approximation
4.2. VB Theory and its wavefunctions, sigma bond and pi bond
4.3. Resonance and Hybridisation
4.4. Molecular Orbitals: LCAOs
4.5. Homonuclear diatomic molecules; heteronuclear diatomic molecules

reviews.author: YareYaredaze
reviews.title: 冇得DING!
reviews.comment_content:
個course因為science 分group A group B + for chemistry student 讀所以冇phys/linear algebra 底都可以理解到，係開頭辛苦啲。

Topic 1: Introduction to Quantum Theory
1.1: 講返科學家點樣發現Energy quantization + 少少Physic 現象 (ΔE = hv, photoelectric effect, de broglie relation)

1.2: Schrodinger equation
一堆quantum mechanics 既 basic rules，乜野係wavefunction, normalization, orthogonality, expectation value... and uncertainty principle.
[最難捱就係呢part 架啦，比多啲心機理解之後輕鬆好多]

Topic 2: Motion
Translation, vibration, rotation.
除左translation 會show 比你睇乜野係quantum tunneling 之外(with equations)，vibration 同rotation都算係輕輕帶過，你會知d energy of motion 點計，但入面乜野係angular momentum 同moment of inertia 呢基本就唔需要知的。

[midterm之後]
Topic 3:
用schrodinger equation 去揾hydrogenic atom/ many electron atoms 既electron energy ，用wavefunction 去解釋Aufbau Principle, Pauli Exclusion principle, Hund's Rule.

Topic 4:
用quantum mechanics 去講返molecule; Valence Bond Theory & Molecular Theory 仲有Huckel Approximation.

其實好多concept 以前都有學過，呢個course 只係比返個concept 既本體(which are equations)你知，究竟我哋以前Gen Chem (shape of orbitals, hund's rule), orgchem (resonance, huckel's rule), inorgchem (mo theory) 讀過既野，係點樣揾出嚟。

鐘意尋根究底既人不能錯過!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
比起淨係教你點樣去應付考試，Professor更加注重equation本身係點樣揾出嚟，當然考試係唔會考的，堂堂都寫爆哂個白板仲要擦多幾次先講得完，上佢堂就係superposition of 享受/痛苦，你唔温足書，咁痛苦個probability 就大啲喇 :).

Prof 份人幾nice，上堂前會問下我地呢排有咩搞，phychem學成點，整下survey 問大家意見，平時上堂解釋又好(係快左啲)，有咩跟甩左落堂即問就ok。

Physical Chemistry seems to have the best Chem professors.

While they both complained about the difficulty of online teaching, I think their lectures were still good, they like to draw on slides to explain concepts or proving mathematical concepts.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Died of A Slip
reviews.comment_content:
- Introduction to Quantum Mechanics (E = hf), Black Body Radiation, Photoelectric Effect [(1/2)mv^2 = hf - (work function)], Wave-Particle Duality & Uncertainty Principle

- Hamiltonian/PE/Momentum Operators, Hermiticity, 1D Particle-in-the-Box/Well Model, Quantum v.s. Classical Harmonic Oscillators

- WAVEFUNCTIONs, Time-Independent Schrödinger's Equation (Eigenvalue & Partial Differential Equation), Electronic, Translational & Vibrational Energy

- PROBABILITY DENSITY, PROBABILITY FUNCTIONs & Quantum Tunneling [kh/(2π) = (2mE)^(1/2)]

----- Mid-Term Exam -----

- 2D Rotational Schrödinger's Equations, Angular Momentum & Rotational Energy

- Coulumb's Law, Oppenheimer's Approximation, Atomic, Valence-Bond & Molecular Orbital Theory (CHEM 1030 deeper, advanced algebra & matrix operations at last)

----- Final -----

reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor tried his best to make QM easy to understand by talking about some examples and applications to daily life. This made me able to accept QM comfortably. And he told us not to be afraid of the notations, this made me to accept QM even more easily.
  The lectures were interactive (he liked to ask some questions, gave examples to extend our thinking, and sometimes he invite some students to do the problems ha~) LIKE IT

  In March he sent out questionnaires in class to let us fill in 3 good points and 3 points for improvement about his teaching. He do really responded to our suggestions. I haven't seen such a good instructor before.

  Lastly, the math icon in his notes was really cute and interesting, I LOVE IT!

reviews.author: R_Liaw
reviews.comment_content:
over simplified, skipped many math and physics details.
many topics were touched in general chemistry I.
Overall is too easy and too brief.

Topic 1: Background of Quantum Mechanics model: quantization, wave-particle duality, uncertainty principle.
Topic 2: QM theory, operators and wavefunctions for translation, vibration, rotation.
Topic 3: Solving schrodinger equation for H-like system (focus in interpreting the solution), Many-electron atoms (electron configuration and related rules, orbital approximation)
Topic 4: QM description of molecule in valence bond theory, molecular orbital theory and Huckel's approximation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Huang is one of my favourite instructor in chemistry department.
He tried his best to make sure majority of the class can follow.
There is a review lecture after every topic, with many sample question and exercise. If you go to class and attend the lecture, there is no way you cannot catch the key ideas.
His accent and tone is also one of the best in chemistry department.
He provided lecture video but I strongly recommend you to attend his lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:

midterm 40%
final 50%

midterm and final are quite similar to homework, in-class exercise and examples in review session.

reviews.author: H_Barnes
reviews.title: Good content with a good professor willing to interact with students
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Quantum Theory, wave-functions, quantum theory of motion, vibration, rotation.
Hydrogen physics, atomic/molecular systems and structures and spin.
Solving the hydrogen/hydrogenic Schrodinger's equation to obtain the orbital structure/energy/angular momentum, etc.
Molecular orbital, the variational principle and Huckel theory.

Overall not too hard stuff but with lots of physics concepts and some maths included.

My opinion is that it is not detailed enough about the content on spin.

Textbook: Atkins Physical Chemistry 10th Edition
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Huang's teaching is quite interesting and he gives the explanation of the key concepts in a very detailed way. Though not every time the students can understand but at least I know he is trying his best to explain and teach us.
One time he uses a simile of the Pokemon Go game to explain the relationship with eigen-function and eigen-values. This is a quite interesting part.
After first few lectures, he spent half of the class period distributing a questionnaire to let us list the pros and cons of his way of teaching to make improvement and that was an impressive lecture. He also let us vote for the date for the date of the midterm exam and so the atmosphere was quite relaxed and free.
He sometimes asked some simple questions in class to review the previous class and invited some volunteer to answer him or write the math/calculation on the whiteboard.

Overall his lectures were quite easy to understand and his way of teaching was detailed and interesting.

reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload.
Only 4 assignments (with around 7 questions) throughout the semester and the questions are simply some review questions and simple, to let you apply some of the concepts taught. Usually we have weeks to complete them so it is not a rush.

He would release some review note/additional exercise and lecture video to facilitate our revision for the exams. So overall the class progress is easy to follow and so it is not stressful to revise for the final LOL. Therefore there is no high workload for this course.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor made a questionnaire after assignment 1 to let us list the advantages and disadvantages of teaching, and professor changed according to the disadvantages.
The lecture was interesting and easily understood. Professor gave a lot of examples to explain some difficult theories, like use Pokemon GO to explain eigenvalues and eigenfunctions. There may be one or two questions in the class, the professor will give about 3 minutes to ask volunteer to write the answer process.

reviews.comment_workload:
Less workload, only has 4 assignment. Self test and answer will be given. The answers of the question on text book are also given.
Total 4 assignments, each Chapter has one, each assignment 100 points. Deadline is a week after finishing each Chapter. In assignment 1, there are 10 questions. However, during the questionnaire, a lot of student advice reduce the number of questions, and give some optional self exercise. After changing, assignment 2~4 has 6~7 questions. Meanwhile, because the grading only depends on 2 highest grades, you only need to submit at least 2 assignments.
